spanish: Mi mamá no habla muy bien inglés.
finnish: Äitini ei puhu englantia kovin hyvin.
english: My mom doesn't speak English very well.

spanish: Mi padre no bebe alcohol. "El mío tampoco."
finnish: Isäni ei juo alkoholia. "Ei minunkaan isäni."
english: My father doesn't drink. "Neither does my father."

spanish: Yo vivo con mis padres.
english: I live with my parents.

spanish: El padre de ella es japonés.
english: Her father is Japanese.

spanish: Su mujer es francesa.
english: His wife is French.

spanish: Mi padre murió de cáncer de pulmón.
english: My father died of lung cancer.

spanish: Su hijo temblaba de terror.
english: His son trembled with fear.

spanish: Mi hija tiene previsto casarse en junio.
english: My daughter is to get married in June.

spanish: Ella tiene siete hijos.
english: She has seven sons.

spanish: Su madre era de la familia Kennedy.
english: Her mother was a Kennedy.

spanish: Él es del tipo de hombres que no toman muy en serio a las mujeres.
finnish: Hän on sen tyypin kaveri, joka ei ota naisia kovin vakavasti.
english: He's the kind of guy who doesn't take women seriously.

spanish: A él le gusta cocinar para su familia.
finnish: Hänestä on mukavaa laittaa ruokaa perheelleen.
english: He likes cooking for his family.

spanish: ¿Está tu madre en casa?
english: Is your mother at home now?

spanish: Ella se parece a su tía.
english: She looks like her aunt.

spanish: El bebé lloró toda la noche.
english: The baby cried all night.

spanish: Él tiene otro hijo.
english: He has another son.

spanish: ¿Tiene hijos?
english: Do you have kids?

spanish: ¿Cómo está mi hijo?
english: How's my son doing?

spanish: Amo a mi esposa.
english: I love my wife.

spanish: Quiero limpiar la casa antes de que vuelvan mis padres.
finnish: Haluan siivota talon ennen kuin vanhempani tulevat takaisin.
english: I want to clean the house before my parents return.

spanish: El ruido va a despertar al bebé.
english: The noise will wake the baby up.

spanish: Su hijo se cayó por el precipicio.
english: His son fell over the cliff.

spanish: Tu padre es alto.
english: Your father is tall.

spanish: ¿Cuántos años tienen vuestros hijos?
english: How old are your children?

spanish: Los niños necesitan amor.
english: Children need loving.

spanish: He ido al hospital a ver a mi mujer.
english: I went to the hospital to see my wife.

spanish: La niña temblaba de miedo.
english: The girl trembled with fear.

spanish: Él es un poco como su padre.
english: He's a little like his father.

spanish: Sus padres eran granjeros.
english: His parents were farmers.

spanish: ¿Es ésta tu familia?
english: Is this your family?

spanish: Mis padres están divorciados.
english: My parents got divorced.

spanish: Él ya no es un niño.
english: He is no longer a child.

spanish: Estoy buscando a mi hermano.
english: I'm looking for my brother.

spanish: Tengo dos hermanos y una hermana.
finnish: Minulla on kaksi veljeä ja yksi sisko.
english: I have two brothers and a sister.

spanish: Mi mujer está cocinando.
english: My wife is cooking.

spanish: El bebé tiene un día.
english: The baby is one day old.

spanish: La mujer se lava la cara.
english: The woman washes her face.

spanish: Él no tiene hijos.
english: He doesn't have any children.

spanish: Su hermano siempre está viendo la televisión.
finnish: Hänen veljensä katsoo koko ajan televisiota.
english: His brother is always watching TV.

spanish: Mi padre es médico.
english: My father is a doctor.

spanish: Mi padre vive y trabaja en Tokio.
finnish: Minun isäni asuu ja tekee töitä Tokiossa.
english: My father lives and works in Tokyo.

spanish: Necesito algo para un niño.
english: I need something for a child.

spanish: Ella fue a la escuela a pesar del dolor que sentía en su pierna derecha.
finnish: Hän meni kouluun, vaikka hänen oikea jalkansa oli kipeä.
english: She went to school in spite of the pain in her right leg.

spanish: Mi mujer es médica.
english: My wife is a doctor.

spanish: Él es mi hermano.
english: He is my brother.

spanish: Es mi hermano.
english: He is my brother.

spanish: Jack es muy severo con sus hijos.
english: Jack is very severe with his children.

spanish: Su hijo tiene ocho años.
english: His son is eight years old.

spanish: Betty mató a su madre.
english: Betty killed her mother.

spanish: Mi madre cocina bien.
english: My mother cooks well.

spanish: Tienen dos hijas.
english: They have two daughters.

spanish: Mi padre no va siempre andando al trabajo.
english: My father does not always walk to work.

spanish: Mi padre es un hombre de negocios.
english: My father is a businessman.

spanish: Tengo dos hermanas mayores.
english: I have two older sisters.

spanish: Las dos hermanas son muy guapas.
english: Both sisters are very beautiful.

spanish: Tiene siete hijos.
english: He has seven sons.

spanish: Me gustaría ver a tu hermana.
english: I'd like to see your sister.

spanish: Mi esposa murió de cáncer.
english: My wife died of cancer.

spanish: Conozco a tu padre.
english: I know your father.

spanish: Papá no está en casa.
english: Dad's not home.

spanish: Mañana viene mi tío a visitarnos.
english: My uncle is coming to see us tomorrow.

spanish: Tengo dos primos.
english: I have two cousins.

spanish: Ayer ayudé a mi padre.
english: I helped my father yesterday.

spanish: A mi abuelo le gusta andar.
english: My grandfather likes to walk.

spanish: ¡Feliz día de la madre!
english: Happy Mother's Day!

spanish: Ella odiaba a su marido.
english: She hated her husband.

spanish: A los niños les gusta trepar a los árboles.
english: Children like climbing trees.

spanish: Los niños deberían jugar fuera.
english: Children should play outside.

spanish: Jack se parece a su padre.
english: Jack resembles his father.

spanish: La abuela de Tom parece estar sana.
english: Tom's grandmother looks healthy.

spanish: El poeta expresó su ardiente pasión por la mujer que amaba.
finnish: Runoilija ilmaisi palavat tunteensa rakastamaansa naista kohtaan.
english: The poet expressed his burning passion for the woman he loved.

spanish: Mi hermano mayor es profesor.
english: My older brother is a teacher.

spanish: El tío Tom es el hermano de mi madre.
english: Uncle Tom is my mother's brother.

spanish: Mi padre está sano.
english: My father is in good health.

spanish: Sigue el ejemplo de tu hermana.
english: Follow the example of your sister.

spanish: Mi madre está a dieta.
english: My mother is on a diet.

spanish: Mi hijo puede contar hasta cien ahora.
english: My son can count up to a hundred now.

spanish: Son mis primos.
english: They are my cousins.

spanish: Mi madre está en la cocina.
english: My mother is in the kitchen.

spanish: No siempre obedecen a sus padres.
english: They don't always obey their parents.

spanish: Mi hermana es famosa.
english: My sister is famous.

spanish: Mi mujer es vegetariana.
english: My wife is a vegetarian.

spanish: Nuestro hijo murió en la guerra.
english: Our son died during the war.

spanish: Mi hermana se parece a mi abuela.
english: My sister resembles my grandmother.

spanish: Él es de esa clase de hombres que toman a las mujeres no muy en serio.
finnish: Hän on sen tyypin kaveri, joka ei ota naisia kovin vakavasti.
english: He's the type of guy who doesn't take women very seriously.

spanish: Mi mujer odia los gatos.
english: My wife hates cats.

spanish: Vivo con mis padres.
english: I live with my parents.

spanish: Su padre es japonés.
english: Your father is Japanese.

spanish: Su papá es japonés.
english: His father is Japanese.

spanish: A mi padre le gusta el tenis.
english: My father likes tennis.

spanish: Siendo huérfano, mi padre tuvo que comenzar a ganar dinero a los diez.
finnish: Koska oli orpo, isäni täytyi aloittaa rahan ansaitseminen kymmenvuotiaana.
english: Being an orphan, my father had to start earning money at ten.

spanish: El bebé se puso a llorar.
english: The baby started to cry.

spanish: ¿Cómo está tu mujer?
english: How's your wife?

spanish: Mis hijos están en la escuela.
english: My children are at school.

spanish: Finalmente, mi hermana se casó.
english: Finally, my sister got married.

spanish: Mi hijo cree en Papá Noel.
english: My son believes in Father Christmas.

spanish: Tu padre es japonés.
english: Your father is Japanese.

spanish: Él es un amigo de mi hermano.
english: He's a friend of my brother's.

spanish: Él conduce a menudo el coche de su padre.
english: He often drives his father's car.

spanish: Mi tío me dio su coche.
english: My uncle gave me his car.

spanish: Mi hijo todavía no sabe contar.
english: My son can't count yet.

spanish: Mi hermano puede correr muy rápido.
english: My brother can run very fast.

spanish: Nos estamos distanciando del resto de la familia.
english: We're distancing ourselves from the rest of the family.

spanish: Los dos hermanos murieron.
english: The two brothers died.

spanish: La joven llevaba un niño en sus brazos.
english: The young lady carried a child in her arm.

spanish: Has de obedecer a tus padres.
english: You have to obey your parents.

spanish: La primera estación del año es la primavera.
english: The first season of the year is spring.

spanish: Su padre come ahí dos veces a la semana.
finnish: Hänen isänsä syö täällä kaksi kertaa viikossa.
english: His father eats there twice a week.

spanish: Mi madre me compró una bicicleta nueva.
english: Mother bought me a new bicycle.

spanish: Me gusta la primavera.
english: I like spring.

spanish: ¿Ella es tu madre?
english: Is she your mother?

spanish: Tiene tres hermanas mayores.
english: He has three older sisters.

spanish: Quiero que mi padre vea la película.
finnish: Haluan, että isäni näkee sen elokuvan.
english: I want my father to see the movie.

spanish: ¿Estás orgulloso de tu padre?
english: Are you proud of your father?

spanish: ¿Estás orgullosa de tu padre?
english: Are you proud of your father?

spanish: ¿Estáis orgullosos de vuestro padre?
english: Are you proud of your father?

spanish: ¿Estáis orgullosas de vuestro padre?
english: Are you proud of your father?

spanish: Ella le compró una cámara a su hijo.
english: She bought her son a camera.

spanish: Mi hermano se parece mucho a mí.
finnish: Veljeni on todella samannäköinen kuin minä.
english: My brother looks very similar to me.

spanish: No es tan alto como su padre.
finnish: Hän ei ole yhtä pitkä kuin hänen isänsä.
english: He is not as tall as his father.

spanish: Ahora Tom vive con su tío.
english: Tom is living with his uncle now.

spanish: Papá es un buen hombre.
english: Father is a good person.

spanish: Mi prima va a tener un niño el mes que viene.
english: My cousin is having a baby next month.

spanish: Mamá me hizo un traje nuevo.
english: Mother made me a new suit.

spanish: Las mujeres observan y los hombres piensan.
english: Women observe and men think.

spanish: ¿Dónde vive tu abuelo?
english: Where does your grandfather live?

spanish: El doctor le aconsejó a mi padre que dejara de fumar.
english: The doctor advised my father to give up smoking.

spanish: Mi padre se fue a pescar.
english: My father went fishing.

spanish: Se sentía cansado.
english: He felt tired.

spanish: El niño se mantuvo en silencio.
english: The boy remained silent.

spanish: Tenemos dos hijos.
english: We have two children.

spanish: ¿Tienen hijos?
english: Do you have kids?

spanish: ¿Tenés una hermana, Lucia?
english: Do you have a sister, Lucia?

spanish: Lucía, ¿tienes una hermana?
english: Do you have a sister, Lucia?

spanish: Estoy orgulloso de mi hijo.
english: I'm proud of my son.

spanish: Ella prometió casarse con él.
finnish: Hän lupasi mennä naimisiin hänen kanssaan.
english: She promised to marry him.

spanish: ¿Él tiene hijos?
english: Does he have children?

spanish: Pedro no tiene hermanas.
english: Pedro has no sisters.

spanish: Tom conoce al padre de Mary.
english: Tom knows Mary's father.

spanish: Él tiene una hermosa hija.
english: He has a beautiful daughter.

spanish: Mamá tiene fiebre.
english: Mom has a fever.

spanish: Mi hermana llora a menudo.
english: My sister often cries.

spanish: ¿Alguien sabe dónde está mi hijo?
english: Does someone know where my son is?

spanish: Sally obligó a su hermano a limpiar el baño.
english: Sally made his brother clean the bathroom.

spanish: Yo te mostraré que el hombre puede renacer de sus cenizas.
finnish: Minä näytän sinulle, kuinka mies pystyy uudestisyntymään tuhkistaan.
english: I will show you that man can be reborn from his ashes.

spanish: Han pasado cinco años desde que mi padre murió.
finnish: Minun isäni kuolemasta on viisi vuotta.
english: Five years have gone by since my father died.

spanish: Tom tiene dos hijos. Ambos viven en Boston.
finnish: Tomilla on kaksi poikaa. Molemmat heistä asuvat Bostonissa.
english: Tom has two sons. Both of them live in Boston.

spanish: A lo largo de los años, mi madre me mintió acerca de tantas cosas.
finnish: Vuosien aikana äitini valehteli minulle niin monesta asiasta.
english: Over the years my mother lied to me about so many things.

spanish: Mi mujer me pega.
english: My wife beats me.

spanish: Mi hija se va a casar en junio.
english: My daughter is getting married in June.

spanish: Él es la oveja negra de la familia.
english: He's the black sheep of the family.

spanish: Tengo un amigo que su padre es un pianista conocido.
finnish: Minulla on ystävä, jonka isä on tunnettu pianisti.
english: I have a friend whose father is a famous pianist.

spanish: Papá, no puedo caminar más. Llévame.
finnish: Isä, en jaksa kävellä enää yhtään. Kanna minua.
english: Daddy, I can't walk any more. Carry me.

spanish: Tom y Mary esperan tener su primogénito el próximo mes.
finnish: Tomi ja Mari saavat esikoisensa ensi kuussa.
english: Tom and Mary are expecting their first child next month.

spanish: Ahora mi mujer está haciendo la comida.
english: My wife is cooking right now.

spanish: Busco a tu hermana. ¿Dónde está ella?
english: I'm looking for your sister. Where is she?

spanish: Él vive con sus padres.
english: He lives with his parents.

spanish: ¿Cómo está su esposa?
english: How's your wife?

spanish: La policía buscó al niño desaparecido.
english: The police searched for the missing child.

spanish: Mary es la mujer de mis sueños.
english: Mary is the woman of my dreams.

spanish: Tenía celos de mi hermano.
english: I was jealous of my brother.

spanish: Tom era un pesado desde antes que naciera su hija.
finnish: Tom oli ilkeä ihminen ennen kuin hänen tyttärensä syntyi.
english: Tom was a mean man before his daughter was born.

spanish: Mary es la hija de Tom.
english: Mary is Tom's daughter.

spanish: Tom es hijo único.
english: Tom is an only child.

spanish: Mi colega y su marido son ambos americanos.
finnish: Työtoverini ja hänen aviomiehensä ovat molemmat amerikkalaisia.
english: My colleague and her husband are both American.

spanish: ¿Sigues enamorado de tu esposa?
english: Are you still in love with your wife?

spanish: ¿Cómo está tu madre?
english: How's your mother?

spanish: Ella es mi hermana.
english: She's my sister.

spanish: Él es mi tío.
english: He's my uncle.

spanish: Mi madre tiene dos hermanos.
english: My mother has two brothers.

spanish: Tom es el padre ideal.
english: Tom is the perfect father.

spanish: Su hermano es casado, pero no tiene hijos.
finnish: Hänen veljensä on naimisissa, mutta hänellä ei ole lapsia.
english: His brother is married, but he doesn't have children.

spanish: Mi padre maneja muy bien.
english: My father drives very well.

spanish: ¿Ella tiene hijos?
english: Does she have children?

spanish: Di a luz a mi primer hijo el año pasado.
english: I gave birth to my first child last year.

spanish: ¿Tienes hijos?
english: Do you have kids?

spanish: Vos no sabés lo que es perder a la familia entera en una guerra.
finnish: Et tiedä mitä on menettää koko perheensä sodassa.
english: You don't know what it's like to lose your entire family in a war.

spanish: Mi abuela habla despacio.
english: My grandmother speaks slowly.

spanish: Mi abuela vivía con nosotros.
english: My grandmother lived with us.

spanish: Mi abuela vivía con nosotras.
english: My grandmother lived with us.

spanish: Estoy buscando un regalo para mi padre.
english: I'm looking for a gift for my father.

spanish: Odio a las mujeres celosas.
english: I hate jealous women.

spanish: Creo que eres la mujer que he estado esperando toda mi vida.
finnish: Luulen että olet nainen jota olen odottanut koko ikäni.
english: I think you're the woman I've been waiting for all my life.

spanish: Tom es el más alto de su familia.
english: Tom is the tallest in his family.

spanish: Mi padre es alto.
english: My father is tall.

spanish: Mary es la exesposa de Tom.
english: Mary is Tom's ex-wife.

spanish: Vuestro padre parece muy amable.
english: Your father seems very nice.

spanish: La muerte de mi abuela fue un gran shock.
english: My grandmother's death was a big shock.

spanish: Te prometo que me quedaré contigo hasta que llegue tu padre.
finnish: Lupaan pysyä luonasi kunnes isäsi saapuu.
english: I promise you I'll stay with you until your father arrives.

spanish: Mi padre maneja un restaurante.
english: My father runs a restaurant.

spanish: Mi papá va a trotar todas las mañanas.
english: My father goes jogging every morning.

spanish: Él siempre me trata como a un niño.
finnish: Hän aina kohtelee minua kuin lasta.
english: He always treats me like a child.

spanish: Allí vi a una extraña mujer.
english: I saw a strange woman there.

spanish: Mi familia no es muy grande.
finnish: Minun perheeni ei ole kovin suuri.
english: My family is not very large.

spanish: Mi padre vive en el campo.
english: My father lives in the country.

spanish: Abandonó a sus hijos.
english: She abandoned her children.

spanish: Tom es el abuelo de Mary.
english: Tom is Mary's grandfather.

spanish: Tom luce como su padre.
english: Tom looks like his father.

spanish: Mi padre es rico.
english: My father is rich.

spanish: Ella fue una huérfana que perdió a sus padres en un accidente de avión.
finnish: Hän oli orpo, joka menetti vanhempansa lentokone-onnettomuudessa.
english: She was an orphan who lost her parents in a plane crash.

spanish: Abandonó el país después de la muerte del abuelo.
finnish: Hän lähti maasta isoisänsä kuoleman jälkeen.
english: He left the country after his grandfather's death.

spanish: Conozco muy bien a tu padre.
english: I know your father very well.

spanish: Mi primo es un poco mayor que yo.
english: My cousin is a little older than I am.

spanish: Mi prima es un poco mayor que yo.
english: My cousin is a little older than I am.

spanish: Mamá está preparando la cena.
english: Mom is getting dinner ready.

spanish: El niño se acostó con los calcetines puestos.
english: The boy went to bed with his socks on.

spanish: A veces me deprimo.
english: I get depressed at times.

spanish: Mi esposo está desempleado y busca trabajo.
finnish: Mieheni on työttömänä ja etsii töitä.
english: My husband is out of work and looking for a job.

spanish: En el mundo, hay más mujeres que hombres.
finnish: Maailmassa on enemmän naisia kuin miehiä.
english: There are more women than men in the world.

spanish: Tomándolo todo en cuenta, la vida de mi padre fue feliz.
finnish: Kaikki asiat huomioon ottaen, isäni elämä oli onnellinen.
english: All things taken into consideration, my father's life was a happy one.

spanish: No sé nada acerca de su familia.
english: I don't know anything about her family.

spanish: Debes amar a tu madre.
english: One should love one's own mother.

spanish: Alice es mi madre.
english: Alice is my mother.

spanish: Ellos van a tener un bebé.
english: They're going to have a baby.

spanish: Finalmente conocí a la mujer adecuada.
english: I finally met the right woman.

spanish: Su hijo se porta bien.
english: His child behaves well.

spanish: Mi papá está en el baño afeitándose.
english: My father is shaving in the bathroom.

spanish: Comúnmente a los niños pequeños le gustan los libros sobre dragones y otros monstruos.
finnish: Pienet lapset pitävät usein lohikäärmeistä ja muista hirviöistä kertovista kirjoista.
english: Small children often like books about dragons and other monsters.

spanish: No sé cuándo volverá mi madre.
finnish: En tiedä milloin äitini palaa takaisin.
english: I don't know when my mother will come back.

spanish: Son los libros de mi abuelo.
english: They are my grandfather's books.

spanish: Cuando él sonrió, los niños vieron sus largos y grises dientes.
finnish: Kun hän hymyili, lapset näkivät hänen pitkät harmaat hampaansa.
english: When he smiled, the children saw his long, gray teeth.

spanish: Jorgen ama a su esposa.
english: Jorgen loves his wife.

spanish: ¿Dónde están vuestros padres?
english: Where are your parents?

spanish: Mi hermano quiere matarme.
english: My brother wants to kill me.

spanish: ¿Aún sigue enamorado de su mujer?
english: Do you still love your wife?

spanish: Julia da un beso a su hija.
english: Julia kisses her daughter.

spanish: Ellos tienen doce hijos.
english: They have twelve children.

spanish: Es tu exmujer.
english: It's your ex-wife.

spanish: Ella cuida a mis hijos.
english: She takes care of my children.

spanish: Mi hija se casará en junio.
english: My daughter will get married in June.

spanish: El padre de Tom es un alcohólico.
english: Tom's father is an alcoholic.

spanish: ¿Es buena cocinera tu esposa?
english: Is your wife a good cook?

spanish: Un perro feroz atacó a la niña.
english: A fierce dog attacked the girl.

spanish: Tom era el hijastro de Mary.
english: Tom was Mary's stepchild.

spanish: No es cierto que ambos padres se hayan esforzado por encontrar a su hija.
finnish: Ei ole totta että molemmat vanhemmat yrittivät kovasti etsiä tytärtään.
english: It is not true that both of the parents tried hard in search of their daughter.

spanish: A menudo escribe cartas a sus padres.
english: He often writes letters to his parents.

spanish: Yo ya no soy tu mujer. ¡Tu mujer es Tatoeba!
finnish: En ole enää vaimosi. Vaimosi on Tatoeba!
english: I'm not your wife anymore. Your wife is Tatoeba!

spanish: Tu nombre me resulta familiar.
english: Your name sounds familiar to me.

spanish: Mentí a mis padres.
english: I lied to my parents.

spanish: Ella cuidó de los niños.
english: She took care of the children.

spanish: Mi tía me mostró cómo hacer buen café.
finnish: Tätini näytti minulle, miten hyvää kahvia tehdään.
english: My aunt showed me how to make good coffee.

spanish: A mi madre le encanta la música.
english: My mother loves music.

spanish: Quiero a mi hija.
english: I love my daughter.

spanish: La familia de Tom vive en Boston.
english: Tom's family lives in Boston.

spanish: La familia cenó reunida.
english: The family ate dinner together.

spanish: Mi madre me regaló su máquina de coser.
english: My mother gave me her sewing machine.

spanish: Jugué tenis con mi hermano.
english: I played tennis with my brother.

spanish: Tom aseguró ser el hijo de un hombre rico.
finnish: Tom väitti olevansa erään rikkaan miehen poika.
english: Tom claimed to be the son of a rich man.

spanish: Esos dos niños tenían la misma edad.
english: Those two children were the same age.

spanish: Soy tu hermano.
english: I'm your brother.

spanish: Su mujer es sueca.
english: His wife is Swedish.

spanish: Tom se parece a su padre.
english: Tom resembles his father.

spanish: El bebé lloró.
english: The baby cried.

spanish: Quiero a mi madre.
english: I love my mom.

spanish: No quiero niños.
english: I don't want kids.

spanish: ¿Tu padre es médico?
english: Is your father a doctor?

spanish: Tengo un amigo cuyo padre es un actor famoso.
finnish: Minulla on ystävä, jonka isä on kuuluisa näyttelijä.
english: I have a friend whose father is a famous actor.

spanish: ¿Cómo se llama vuestra hija?
english: What's your daughter's name?

spanish: ¿Esta es tu familia?
english: Is this your family?

spanish: Ella vive con su padre.
english: She lives with her dad.

spanish: Él siempre habla mal de su esposa.
finnish: Hän sanoo aina ilkeitä asioita vaimostaan.
english: He is always speaking ill of his wife.

spanish: El doctor aconsejó que mi madre se quedara tres días más en cama.
finnish: Lääkäri ohjeisti että äitini pysyy sängyssä vielä kolme päivää.
english: The doctor advised that my mother stay in bed for three more days.

spanish: Él a menudo atribuye su éxito a su esposa.
finnish: Hän lukee usein menestyksensä vaimonsa ansioksi.
english: He often attributes his success to his wife.

spanish: Él se portó como un niño.
english: He behaved like a child.

spanish: No se sentía bien.
english: She was not feeling well.

spanish: Tom tiene tres hermanas mayores.
english: Tom has three older sisters.

spanish: Mary es la abuela de Tom.
english: Mary is Tom's grandmother.

spanish: Sus dos abuelos están muertos.
english: Both his grandparents are dead.

spanish: Quiero vivir en casa con mi familia.
english: I want to live at home with my family.

spanish: ¿Cómo estuvo la boda?
english: How was the wedding?

spanish: Los dos hermanos siguen vivos.
english: Both brothers are still alive.

spanish: Estoy en contra del matrimonio.
english: I'm against the marriage.

spanish: Las mujeres con buen corazón siempre son bonitas, pero las mujeres bonitas no siempre tienen buen corazón.
finnish: Hyväsydämiset naiset ovat aina kauniita, mutta kauniit naiset eivät aina ole hyväsydämisiä.
english: Good-hearted women are always beautiful, but beautiful women are not always good-hearted.

spanish: ¿Tienes una hermana gemela?
english: Do you have a twin sister?

spanish: ¿Tienes un hermano gemelo?
english: Do you have a twin brother?

spanish: No quería que lo supiera mi mamá.
finnish: En halunnut minun äitini tietävän siitä.
english: I didn't want my mom to know.

spanish: Abandonó a su mujer.
english: He left his wife.

spanish: Dejó a su mujer.
english: He left his wife.

spanish: Dejó a su esposa.
english: He left his wife.

spanish: Él no escucha a sus padres.
english: He doesn't listen to his parents.

spanish: Hay un niño perdido.
english: A child is missing.

spanish: Es mi hijo.
english: He's my son.

spanish: Eres mi hijo.
english: You're my son.

spanish: Tom es mi hijo.
english: Tom is my son.

spanish: Mi prima va a tener un hijo el mes que viene.
english: My cousin is having a baby next month.

spanish: Wenjin es una mujer china.
english: Wenjin is a Chinese woman.

spanish: Soy la prima de Tom.
english: I'm Tom's cousin.

spanish: ¿Esta es la mujer de Tom?
english: Is this Tom's wife?

spanish: Tom quería casarse con Mary.
finnish: Tomi halusi mennä Marin kanssa naimisiin.
english: Tom wanted to marry Mary.

spanish: Ese es el hermano de Tom.
english: That's Tom's brother.

spanish: Tengo un hijo.
english: I've got a son.

spanish: Tengo tres niños.
english: I have three children.

spanish: Es una mujer celosa.
english: She's a jealous woman.

spanish: La caja es lo suficientemente ligera para ser llevada por un niño.
finnish: Rasia on kyllin kevyt lapsen kantaa.
english: The box is light enough for a child to carry.

spanish: Soy el primo de Tom.
english: I'm Tom's cousin.

spanish: Tom tiene tres hermanas.
english: Tom has three sisters.

spanish: Odio a mi familia.
english: I hate my family.

spanish: Tengo parientes en Boston.
english: I have relatives in Boston.

spanish: Pasé todo el día jugando con mis hijos.
finnish: Minä vietin koko päivän leikkien lasteni kanssa.
english: I spent the whole day playing with my kids.

spanish: María es una madre soltera.
english: Mary is a single mom.

spanish: ¿Por qué llora el bebé?
english: Why is the baby crying?

spanish: Eso es porque eres niña.
finnish: Se johtuu siitä, että olet tyttö.
english: That's because you're a girl.

spanish: Tom no es mi padre.
english: Tom isn't my father.

spanish: Algunas mujeres no se afeitan las piernas.
english: Some women don't shave their legs.

spanish: Tom es mi hermano.
english: Tom is my brother.

spanish: Él siempre dice cosas malas de su esposa.
finnish: Hän sanoo aina ilkeitä asioita vaimostaan.
english: He's always saying bad things about his wife.

spanish: Aquí hay una foto de mi familia.
english: Here is a photograph of my family.

spanish: Los dioses crearon a las mujeres para amansar a los hombres.
english: Gods created women to tame men.

spanish: ¿Cuándo vino a casa tu padre?
english: When did your father come home?

spanish: Mi marido suele irse a trabajar a las 8.
english: My husband usually leaves for work at 8 o'clock.

spanish: Mi hermano ocupa esa bicicleta.
english: My brother uses that bike.

spanish: Los otros niños se reían.
english: The other children laughed.

spanish: Debes de ser el hermano de Tom.
english: You must be Tom's brother.

spanish: Debido a la televisión, niños y niñas no quieren leer libros.
finnish: Television vuoksi pojat ja tytöt eivät halua lukea kirjoja.
english: Because of TV, boys and girls don't want to read books.

spanish: Mi hermana limpia sus zapatos todos los domingos.
english: My sister washes her shoes every Sunday.

spanish: Tu padre está lejos ahora.
english: Your father is far away now.

spanish: La boda es en menos de tres meses.
finnish: Häät ovat alle kolmen kuukauden kuluttua.
english: The wedding is less than three months away.

spanish: Te confundí con tu hermano.
english: I mistook you for your brother.

spanish: El huérfano se reunió con sus dos hermanas cuando tenía cinco años.
finnish: Orpo tapasi kaksi sisartaan, kun hän oli viisi vuotta vanha.
english: The orphan met up with his two sisters when he was five years old.

spanish: Nunca he estado en la casa de mi tío.
finnish: En ole koskaan ollut setäni kodissa.
english: I've never been to my uncle's house.

spanish: El hijo de Tom se llama John.
english: Tom's son's name is John.

spanish: Mi esposa normalmente no bebe café por la noche, y yo tampoco.
finnish: Vaimoni ei tavallisesti juo kahvia öisin, enkä juo minäkään.
english: My wife usually doesn't drink coffee at night, and neither do I.

spanish: Cuando niño él reunía escarabajos.
english: He used to collect beetles when he was a kid.

spanish: Él se sentía incómodo en compañía de su padre.
finnish: Hän tunsi olonsa epämukavaksi hänen isänsä seurassa.
english: He felt uneasy in his father's presence.

spanish: ¿Tu hermana vive ahí?
english: Does your sister live there?

spanish: Ella quiere pasar tiempo con su hija.
finnish: Hän haluaa viettää aikaa tyttärensä kanssa.
english: She wants to spend time with her daughter.

spanish: Cuando yo era niña, pasaba horas sola leyendo en mi pieza.
finnish: Kun olin lapsi, vietin tunteja lukien yksin huoneessani.
english: When I was a child, I would spend hours reading alone in my room.

spanish: Ella pasó toda la Navidad en casa con su familia.
finnish: Hän vietti kaikki joulunsa kotona perheensä kanssa.
english: She spent all of her Christmases at home with her family.

spanish: A mi padre le gusta viajar en avión.
english: My father loves to travel by plane.

spanish: Ellos pretenden casarse mañana.
english: They intend to get married tomorrow.

spanish: ¡Feliz Día Internacional de la Mujer!
english: Happy International Women's Day!

spanish: Él me trata como a un niño.
english: He treats me like a child.

spanish: No dejes que los niños vean esta película.
finnish: Älä anna lasten katsoa tätä filmiä.
english: Don't let the kids watch this film.

spanish: Oramos para que nuestro padre nos perdonara.
english: We prayed that our father would forgive us.

spanish: Tom es el padre perfecto.
english: Tom is the perfect father.

spanish: Él es el hermano menor que nunca tuve.
finnish: Hän on pikkuveli, jota minulla ei koskaan ollut.
english: He's the little brother I never had.

spanish: El avión aterrizó en la granja de mi papá.
english: The plane landed on my dad's farm.

spanish: María demandó a su propia madre.
english: Mary sued her own mother.

spanish: Cuéntame acerca de tu hijo.
english: Tell me about your son.

spanish: El monarca tiene seis hijos.
english: The monarch has six sons.

spanish: ¿Usted ya tiene hijos?
english: Do you have children already?

spanish: A los niños les gusta el jugo de fruta.
english: Children like fruit juice.

spanish: Juntas, las edades de los dos niños equivalían a la edad de su padre.
finnish: Kahden lapsen iät yhdessä vastasivat heidän isänsä ikää.
english: The ages of the two children put together was equivalent to that of their father.

spanish: Él cuidó a su madre después de la muerte de su padre.
finnish: Hän piti huolta äidistään isänsä kuoleman jälkeen.
english: He took care of his mother after his father's death.

spanish: Cristina sufrió mucho desde la muerte de su marido.
finnish: Aviomiehensä kuoleman jälkeen Christina on kärsinyt paljon.
english: Since her husband died, Cristina has suffered a lot.

spanish: Tengo un nuevo pariente: mi hermana se casó, así que ahora tengo un cuñado.
finnish: Minulla on uusi sukulainen: siskoni meni naimisiin, ja nyt minulla on lanko.
english: I have a new relative: my sister got married, so now I have a brother-in-law.

spanish: Si eres una buena niña, te daré dulces.
finnish: Jos olet kiltti tyttö, annan sinulle nameja.
english: If you are a good girl, you shall have candy.

spanish: ¿Cuándo será la boda?
english: When's the wedding?

spanish: ¿Dónde están tus hijos?
english: Where are your kids?

spanish: Mi hermano tiene una cuenta Twitter.
english: My brother has a Twitter account.

spanish: Los tres niños abrieron las puertas del edificio.
english: The three boys opened the doors of the building.

spanish: ¡Piensa en tu familia!
english: Think of your family.

spanish: A mi hermano le interesa aquello que llaman música pop.
finnish: Veljeni on kiinnostunut siitä, mitä sanotaan popmusiikiksi.
english: My brother likes what they call pop music.

spanish: Ella cargaba al bebé en su espalda.
english: She was carrying the baby on her back.

spanish: Mette es la esposa de Jorgen.
english: Mette is Jørgen's wife.

spanish: ¿Cuántos hijos tiene Tom?
english: How many kids does Tom have?

spanish: Las bodas son caras.
english: Weddings are expensive.

spanish: Roberto solía ayudar a su padre en la tienda los fines de semana.
finnish: Robertilla oli tapana auttaa isäänsä kaupassa viikonloppuisin.
english: Robert used to help his father in the store on weekends.

spanish: Mi hermana menor canta muy bien.
english: My youngest sister sings very well.

spanish: Los niños están en la escuela.
english: The kids are at school.

spanish: Tengo mujer e hijos.
english: I have a wife and kids.

spanish: Mi mamá y yo somos completamente diferentes.
finnish: Äitini ja minä olemme täysin erilaisia.
english: My mom and I are completely different.

spanish: La caja es lo suficientemente ligera para que la cargue un niño.
finnish: Rasia on kyllin kevyt lapsen kantaa.
english: The box is light enough for a child to carry.

spanish: Tú no sabes lo que es perder a tu familia entera en una guerra.
finnish: Et tiedä mitä on menettää koko perheensä sodassa.
english: You don't know what it's like to lose your entire family in a war.

spanish: No hay nada más doloroso que perder a tu propio querido hijo.
finnish: Ei ole mitään tuskallisempaa kuin menettää oma rakas lapsensa.
english: There's nothing more painful than losing one's loved child.

spanish: ¿En qué curso va tu hermana?
english: What grade is your sister in?

spanish: Somos una familia de cinco personas.
english: There are five people in our family.

spanish: Tengo una hija de trece años.
finnish: Minulla on tytär, joka on kolmetoistavuotias.
english: I have a daughter who's 13 years old.

spanish: Sé que mi padre me ayudará.
english: I know my father will help me.

spanish: Conocí a la mujer perfecta.
english: I've met the perfect woman.

spanish: Los niños hacen muchas estupideces.
english: Children do a lot of stupid things.

spanish: Los niños a menudo hacen estupideces.
english: Children often do stupid things.

spanish: Los niños dicen cosas tan estúpidas.
english: Children say such stupid things.

spanish: Mi padre durmió durante toda la película.
english: My father slept through the movie.

spanish: Tengo un hijo que acaba de cumplir tres años.
finnish: Minulla on poika, joka täytti juuri kolme.
english: I have a son who's just turned three.

spanish: Tan solo el año pasado tuvimos un hijo.
english: We had a kid just last year.

spanish: Tom tiene solo vagos recuerdos de su abuelo.
finnish: Tomilla on vain hämäriä muistikuvia ukistaan.
english: Tom only has faint memories of his grandfather.

spanish: La esposa de Tom se llama María.
english: Tom's wife is called Mary.

spanish: Mi hermano es más fuerte que yo.
english: My brother is stronger than me.

spanish: Mi papá gasta mucho tiempo en su pasatiempo.
english: My father spends a lot of time on his hobby.

spanish: Tom le dijo a María que para él, ella era la mujer más bella que jamás había conocido.
finnish: Tom kertoi Marylle, että hänen mielestään Mary oli kaunein nainen, jonka Tom on ikinä tavannut.
english: Tom told Mary he thought she was the most beautiful woman he'd ever met.

spanish: Tom construyó esto con su padre.
english: Tom built this with his dad.

spanish: Mi esposo y yo nos hemos apartado el uno de otro y ahora no sabemos cómo revertir el proceso.
finnish: Aviomieheni ja minä olemme ajautuneet toisistamme erilleen ja nyt emme tiedä miten saisimme kehityskulun käännettyä toiseen suuntaan.
english: My husband and I, we have drifted apart, and now we don't know how to reverse the process.

spanish: Tom conoció a su esposa cuando estudiaba en Alemania.
finnish: Tom tapasi vaimonsa kun hän oli opiskelemassa Saksassa.
english: Tom met his wife when he was studying in Germany.

spanish: Tom conoció a su esposa cuando estudiaba en Francia.
finnish: Tom tapasi vaimonsa kun hän oli opiskelemassa Ranskassa.
english: Tom met his wife while he was studying in France.

spanish: El alcoholismo de Tom ha causado muchos problemas en su matrimonio.
finnish: Tomin juominen on aiheuttanut paljon ongelmia hänen avioliitossaan.
english: Tom's drinking has caused a lot of problems in his marriage.

spanish: Tom y María se enamoraron y decidieron casarse.
finnish: Tom ja Mary rakastuivat ja päättivät mennä naimisiin.
english: Tom and Mary fell in love and decided to get married.

spanish: Aún no has conocido a mi familia.
english: You haven't met my family yet.

spanish: Tom tiene una prima de nombre María.
english: Tom has a cousin named Mary.

spanish: Llamaré a mi esposo.
english: I'll call my husband.

spanish: Odio a los padres de Tom.
english: I hate Tom's parents.

spanish: Tom no habla nunca acerca de sus hijos.
finnish: Tom ei puhu koskaan omista lapsistaan.
english: Tom never talks about his kids.

spanish: No tengo hijos.
english: I don't have children.

spanish: Tom tiene tres primos.
english: Tom has three cousins.

spanish: Tom tiene tres primas.
english: Tom has three cousins.

spanish: ¿Bebéis té?
english: Do you drink tea?

spanish: Tienes siete hijos.
english: You have seven children.

spanish: Mi padre ha dejado de beber alcohol.
english: My father stopped drinking.

spanish: En realidad, Susan es tu media hermana.
english: Susan is actually your half sister.

spanish: ¿Sabes por qué al arrollado primavera le dicen arrollado primavera?
english: Do you know why spring rolls are called spring rolls?

spanish: El niño sucio resultó ser un príncipe en disfraz.
english: The dirty boy turned out to be a prince in disguise.

spanish: Tom y María tienen tres hijas.
finnish: Tomilla ja Marilla on kolme tytärtä.
english: Tom and Mary have three daughters.

spanish: Ella era la única mujer.
english: She was the only woman.

spanish: Mis dos hermanos están casados, pero todas mis hermanas son solteras.
finnish: Molemmat veljistäni ovat naimisissa, mutta siskoni ovat kaikki naimattomia.
english: Both my brothers are married, but my sisters are all single.

spanish: Las mujeres no son objetos sexuales.
english: Women are not sex objects.

spanish: Mi padre es un adicto al trabajo que piensa solo en su trabajo las veinticuatro horas.
finnish: Isäni on työnarkomaani joka ajattelee vain työtään kellon ympäri.
english: My father is a workaholic who thinks of nothing but his job 24/7.

spanish: Mi abuelo toma café con un grupo de ancianos cada mañana.
finnish: Vaarini juo kahvia vanhusjoukon kanssa joka aamu.
english: My grandpa drinks coffee with a group of old guys every morning.

spanish: No me quiero casar, pero quiero tener hijos.
finnish: En halua mennä naimisiin, mutta haluan lapsia.
english: I don't want to get married, but I want to have kids.

spanish: Vi muchas caras familiares.
english: I saw many familiar faces.

spanish: ¿Amas a tu madre?
english: Do you love your mother?

spanish: Ellos son hermanos.
english: They're brothers.

spanish: ¿Cuál era el apellido de María antes de casarse?
finnish: Mikä Marin sukunimi olikaan ennen kuin hän meni naimisiin?
english: What was Mary's last name before she got married?

spanish: Tengo un hermano gemelo.
english: I have a twin brother.

spanish: Muchos niños los usan.
english: A lot of kids wear them.

spanish: Ella era una mujer de mediana edad.
english: She was a middle-aged woman.

spanish: María es mi esposa.
english: Mary is my wife.

spanish: Mi madre puso la mesa para la cena.
english: My mother set the table for dinner.

spanish: Te ves igual a tu hermano.
english: You look just like your brother.

spanish: Tu padre habría estado muy orgulloso de ti.
finnish: Isäsi olisi ollut todella ylpeä sinusta.
english: Your father would have been very proud of you.

spanish: ¡Qué padre!
english: Terrific!

spanish: Lo trataba como a mi propio hijo.
english: I treated him like my own son.

spanish: El gran perro asustó al bebé.
english: The big dog frightened the baby.

spanish: Tenemos tres hijos.
english: We have three children.

spanish: El padre de Tom es rico.
english: Tom's father is rich.

spanish: Rómulo y Remo eran hermanos.
english: Romulus and Remus were brothers.

spanish: Tom es mi hermano gemelo.
english: Tom is my twin brother.

spanish: Mi esposa está embarazada.
english: My wife's pregnant.

spanish: Mi mujer está embarazada.
english: My wife's pregnant.

spanish: Las madres son todas unas verdaderas heroínas.
english: Mothers are all real heroines.

spanish: Me casé y tuve hijos.
english: I got married and had children.

spanish: Vengo de una familia de doctores.
english: I come from a family of doctors.

spanish: ¿Creías en Santa Claus cuando eras niño?
english: Did you believe in Santa Claus when you were a child?

spanish: Papá regó las flores.
english: Dad watered the flowers.

spanish: Tom es amigo del hermano menor de mi esposa.
finnish: Tomi on minun vaimoni pikkuveljen ystävä.
english: Tom is a friend of my wife's younger brother.

spanish: Mis padres están en Australia.
english: My parents are in Australia.

spanish: Tom, Mary, John y Alice son amigos. Todos se conocen desde que eran niños.
finnish: Tomi, Mari, Joni ja Alisa ovat ystäviä. He ovat tunteneet toisensa lapsuudesta saakka.
english: Tom, Mary, John and Alice are friends. They've known each other since they were children.

spanish: Eres la mujer de mis sueños.
english: You're the woman of my dreams.

spanish: La mujer de Tom falleció la semana pasada.
english: Tom's wife died last week.

spanish: Los padres de Tom eran canadienses.
english: Tom's parents were Canadian.

spanish: ¿Está mamá aquí?
english: Is Mom here?

spanish: Los guerreros combatieron con valentía, pero la derrota fue inevitable.
finnish: Soturit taistelivat urhoollisesti, mutta tappio oli vääjäämätön.
english: The warriors fought valiantly, but the defeat was inevitable.

spanish: Tu hermano compró un camión rosado la semana pasada.
finnish: Veljesi osti vaaleanpunaisen rekan viime viikolla.
english: Your brother bought a pink truck last week.

spanish: Ayer, mi padre y yo visitamos a María.
finnish: Eilen isäni ja minä vierailimme Marjan luona.
english: Yesterday, my father and I visited Mary.

spanish: Somos como una familia.
english: We're like family.

spanish: ¿Sois hermanos?
english: Are you brothers?

spanish: ¿Son hermanos?
english: Are you brothers?

spanish: ¿Que edad tienen tus hermanos?
english: How old are your brothers and sisters?

spanish: ¿Cuántos años tienen tus hermanos?
english: How old are your brothers and sisters?

spanish: ¿Bebéis?
english: Do you drink?

spanish: No tuvimos mucha lluvia la primavera pasada.
finnish: Viime keväänä emme saaneet paljoa sadetta.
english: We didn't get much rain last spring.

spanish: Tienes unos niños muy monos.
english: Your kids are adorable.

spanish: Mañana, si Dios quiere, estaremos con tus padres.
finnish: Huomenna, jos Luoja suo, olemme vanhempiesi kanssa.
english: Tomorrow, God willing, we'll be with your parents.

spanish: ¿Mary es tu mujer?
english: Is Mary your wife?

spanish: Este cuchillo me lo dio mi abuelo.
finnish: Minun isoisäni antoi minulle tämän veitsen.
english: This knife was given to me by my grandfather.

spanish: Nuestro bebé no habla aún.
english: Our baby isn't talking yet.

spanish: Somos parientes.
english: We're relatives.

spanish: Tom es mi primogénito.
english: Tom is my firstborn.

spanish: Tom es el amigo de mi hijo.
english: Tom is my son's friend.

spanish: Mi padre murió en Vietnam.
english: My father died in Vietnam.
